name: AttributedString.CharacterView
desc: A view into the underlying storage of the attributed string, as Unicode characters.

items.name: init<S>(S)
items.desc: Creates a new instance of a collection containing the elements of a sequence.

items.name: init(repeating: Character, count: Int)
items.desc: Creates a new collection containing the specified number of a single, repeated value.

items.name: var count: Int
items.desc: The number of elements in the collection.

items.name: var first: Character?
items.desc: The first element of the collection.

items.name: var indices: DefaultIndices<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: The indices that are valid for subscripting the collection, in ascending order.

items.name: var isEmpty: Bool
items.desc: A Boolean value indicating whether the collection is empty.

items.name: var last: Character?
items.desc: The last element of the collection.

items.name: var lazy: LazySequence<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: A sequence containing the same elements as this sequence, but on which some operations, such as map and filter, are implemented lazily.

items.name: var underestimatedCount: Int
items.desc: A value less than or equal to the number of elements in the collection.

items.name: func allSatisfy((Character) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether every element of a sequence satisfies a given predicate.

items.name: func append(Character)
items.desc: Adds an element to the end of the collection.

items.name: func append<S>(contentsOf: S)
items.desc: Adds the elements of a sequence or collection to the end of this collection.

items.name: func applying(CollectionDifference<Character>) -> AttributedString.CharacterView?
items.desc: Applies the given difference to this collection.

items.name: func compactMap<ElementOfResult>((Character) -> ElementOfResult?) -> [ElementOfResult]
items.desc: Returns an array containing the non-nil results of calling the given transformation with each element of this sequence.

items.name: func contains(Character) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence contains the given element.

items.name: func contains(where: (Character) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence contains an element that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func difference<C>(from: C) -> CollectionDifference<Character>
items.desc: Returns the difference needed to produce this collection’s ordered elements from the given collection.

items.name: func difference<C>(from: C, by: (C.Element, Character) -> Bool) -> CollectionDifference<Character>
items.desc: Returns the difference needed to produce this collection’s ordered elements from the given collection, using the given predicate as an equivalence test.

items.name: func distance(from: AttributedString.Index, to: AttributedString.Index) -> Int
func drop(while: (Character) -> Bool) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence by skipping elements while predicate returns true and returning the remaining elements.

items.name: func dropFirst(Int) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence containing all but the given number of initial elements.

items.name: func dropLast(Int) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence containing all but the specified number of final elements.

items.name: func elementsEqual<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this sequence and another sequence contain the same elements in the same order.

items.name: func elementsEqual<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence, by: (Character, OtherSequence.Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether this sequence and another sequence contain equivalent elements in the same order, using the given predicate as the equivalence test.

items.name: func enumerated() -> EnumeratedSequence<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a sequence of pairs (n, x), where n represents a consecutive integer starting at zero and x represents an element of the sequence.

items.name: func filter((Character) -> Bool) -> AttributedString.CharacterView
items.desc: Returns a new collection of the same type containing, in order, the elements of the original collection that satisfy the given predicate.

items.name: func first(where: (Character) -> Bool) -> Character?
items.desc: Returns the first element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func firstIndex(of: Character) -> AttributedString.Index?
items.desc: Returns the first index where the specified value appears in the collection.

items.name: func firstIndex(where: (Character) -> Bool) -> AttributedString.Index?
items.desc: Returns the first index in which an element of the collection satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func flatMap<SegmentOfResult>((Character) -> SegmentOfResult) -> [SegmentOfResult.Element]
items.desc: Returns an array containing the concatenated results of calling the given transformation with each element of this sequence.

items.name: func forEach((Character) -> Void)
items.desc: Calls the given closure on each element in the sequence in the same order as a for-in loop.

items.name: func formIndex(inout AttributedString.Index, offsetBy: Int)
items.desc: Offsets the given index by the specified distance.

items.name: func formIndex(inout AttributedString.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: AttributedString.Index) -> Bool
items.desc: Offsets the given index by the specified distance, or so that it equals the given limiting index.

items.name: func formIndex(after: inout AttributedString.Index)
items.desc: Replaces the given index with its successor.

items.name: func formIndex(before: inout AttributedString.Index)
items.desc: Replaces the given index with its predecessor.

items.name: func index(AttributedString.Index, offsetBy: Int, limitedBy: AttributedString.Index) -> AttributedString.Index?
func insert(Character, at: AttributedString.Index)
items.desc: Inserts a new element into the collection at the specified position.

items.name: func insert<C>(contentsOf: C, at: AttributedString.Index)
items.desc: Inserts the elements of a sequence into the collection at the specified position.

items.name: func last(where: (Character) -> Bool) -> Character?
items.desc: Returns the last element of the sequence that satisfies the given predicate.

items.name: func lastIndex(of: Character) -> AttributedString.Index?
items.desc: Returns the last index where the specified value appears in the collection.

items.name: func lastIndex(where: (Character) -> Bool) -> AttributedString.Index?
items.desc: Returns the index of the last element in the collection that matches the given predicate.

items.name: func lexicographicallyPrecedes<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence precedes another sequence in a lexicographical (dictionary) ordering, using the less-than operator (<) to compare elements.

items.name: func lexicographicallyPrecedes<OtherSequence>(OtherSequence, by: (Character, Character) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the sequence precedes another sequence in a lexicographical (dictionary) ordering, using the given predicate to compare elements.

items.name: func makeIterator() -> IndexingIterator<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns an iterator over the elements of the collection.

items.name: func map<T>((Character) -> T) -> [T]
items.desc: Returns an array containing the results of mapping the given closure over the sequence’s elements.

items.name: func max() -> Character?
items.desc: Returns the maximum element in the sequence.

items.name: func max(by: (Character, Character) -> Bool) -> Character?
items.desc: Returns the maximum element in the sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func min() -> Character?
items.desc: Returns the minimum element in the sequence.

items.name: func min(by: (Character, Character) -> Bool) -> Character?
items.desc: Returns the minimum element in the sequence, using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func popLast() -> Character?
items.desc: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.

items.name: func prefix(Int) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence, up to the specified maximum length, containing the initial elements of the collection.

items.name: func prefix(through: AttributedString.Index) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection through the specified position.

items.name: func prefix(upTo: AttributedString.Index) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence from the start of the collection up to, but not including, the specified position.

items.name: func prefix(while: (Character) -> Bool) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence containing the initial elements until predicate returns false and skipping the remaining elements.

items.name: func randomElement() -> Character?
items.desc: Returns a random element of the collection.

items.name: func randomElement<T>(using: inout T) -> Character?
items.desc: Returns a random element of the collection, using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: func reduce<Result>(Result, (Result, Character) -> Result) -> Result
items.desc: Returns the result of combining the elements of the sequence using the given closure.

items.name: func reduce<Result>(into: Result, (inout Result, Character) -> ()) -> Result
items.desc: Returns the result of combining the elements of the sequence using the given closure.

items.name: func remove(at: AttributedString.Index) -> Character
items.desc: Removes and returns the element at the specified position.

items.name: func removeAll(keepingCapacity: Bool)
items.desc: Removes all elements from the collection.

items.name: func removeAll(where: (Character) -> Bool)
items.desc: Removes all the elements that satisfy the given predicate.

items.name: func removeFirst() -> Character
items.desc: Removes and returns the first element of the collection.

items.name: func removeFirst(Int)
items.desc: Removes the specified number of elements from the beginning of the collection.

items.name: func removeLast() -> Character
items.desc: Removes and returns the last element of the collection.

items.name: func removeLast(Int)
items.desc: Removes the specified number of elements from the end of the collection.

items.name: func removeSubrange(Range<AttributedString.Index>)
items.desc: Removes the elements in the specified subrange from the collection.

items.name: func removeSubrange<R>(R)
items.desc: Removes the elements in the specified subrange from the collection.

items.name: func replaceSubrange<C, R>(R, with: C)
items.desc: Replaces the specified subrange of elements with the given collection.

items.name: func reserveCapacity(Int)
items.desc: Prepares the collection to store the specified number of elements, when doing so is appropriate for the underlying type.

items.name: func reversed() -> ReversedCollection<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a view presenting the elements of the collection in reverse order.

items.name: func shuffled() -> [Character]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, shuffled.

items.name: func shuffled<T>(using: inout T) -> [Character]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, shuffled using the given generator as a source for randomness.

items.name: func sorted() -> [Character]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, sorted.

items.name: func sorted(by: (Character, Character) -> Bool) -> [Character]
items.desc: Returns the elements of the sequence, sorted using the given predicate as the comparison between elements.

items.name: func split(maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool, whereSeparator: (Character) -> Bool) -> [Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>]
items.desc: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, that don’t contain elements satisfying the given predicate.

items.name: func split(separator: Character, maxSplits: Int, omittingEmptySubsequences: Bool) -> [Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>]
items.desc: Returns the longest possible subsequences of the collection, in order, around elements equal to the given element.

items.name: func starts<PossiblePrefix>(with: PossiblePrefix) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the initial elements of the sequence are the same as the elements in another sequence.

items.name: func starts<PossiblePrefix>(with: PossiblePrefix, by: (Character, PossiblePrefix.Element) -> Bool) -> Bool
items.desc: Returns a Boolean value indicating whether the initial elements of the sequence are equivalent to the elements in another sequence, using the given predicate as the equivalence test.

items.name: func suffix(Int) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence, up to the given maximum length, containing the final elements of the collection.

items.name: func suffix(from: AttributedString.Index) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Returns a subsequence from the specified position to the end of the collection.

items.name: func withContiguousStorageIfAvailable<R>((UnsafeBufferPointer<Character>) -> R) -> R?
items.desc: Executes a closure on the sequence’s contiguous storage.

items.name: subscript<R>(R) -> Slice<AttributedString.CharacterView>
items.desc: Accesses the contiguous subrange of the collection’s elements specified by a range expression.

items.name: static func + <Other>(Other, AttributedString.CharacterView) -> AttributedString.CharacterView
items.desc: Creates a new collection by concatenating the elements of a sequence and a collection.

items.name: static func + <Other>(AttributedString.CharacterView, Other) -> AttributedString.CharacterView
items.desc: Creates a new collection by concatenating the elements of a collection and a sequence.

items.name: static func + <Other>(AttributedString.CharacterView, Other) -> AttributedString.CharacterView
items.desc: Creates a new collection by concatenating the elements of two collections.

items.name: static func += <Other>(inout AttributedString.CharacterView, Other)
items.desc: Appends the elements of a sequence to a range-replaceable collection.
